text:
Walter Franco (6 January 1945 – 24 October 2019) was a Brazilian rock singer, guitarist, record producer and composer. In 1998 he worked with Rosa Passos for their debut album "Especial Tom Jobim". His 1975 album "Revolver" was No. 50 on "Rolling Stone"s list of the Top 100 Brazilian albums. He was born in São Paulo, Brazil. Other ablums include "Respire Fundo", "Vela Aberta", "Walter Franco" and "Tutano".
Franco died on 24 October 2019 at a São Paulo hospital from a stroke, aged 74.
